Author: gojomo
Content: I presume Google Reader only fetches a feed once for its many users. So how did you control access? (IFrames?)

Author: gaius
Content:
There is a tough competition for these civil servant jobs

Because they are massively, massively corrupt.

http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/comment/columnists/guest_co...

"For nine consecutive years the EU court of auditors has refused to sign off the budget. The numbers are huge. The annual EC budget is around ¤100 billion (£65 billion). The auditors cannot clear 95 per cent of that. We simply cannot tell what is happening to that money"

Author: alexc218
Content: nearly all of the sites out there that you trust with your username/password are susceptible to this. you just have to trust that all of them will protect your privacy, as they indicate in their policies. facebook and google harvest much more personal info on you than this site, btw.

Author: alexc218
Content: nope. you're 100% wrong. there are tons of cheesy matching apps on facebook, but none do exactly what this one does.

Author: prt2101
Content: then you are consenting to a relationship with whoever you match first. if you later say "oh, i didn't really mean to put you on my list!", its kinda like asking someone out and then saying "oh, i didnt really mean to ask you out!"

Author: pshc
Content:
"Xrange(), which generates numbers on demand, is more efficient and generally what’s needed."

They capitalized a case-sensitive identifier because it was at the beginning of the sentence? I'm so conflicted!

Author: snprbob86
Content: There are DOZENS of apps exactly like this one already on Facebook. What does Facebook Connect buy them over being a normal app? And what suggests this one will succeed where all the others failed to achieve critical mass?

Author: cmos
Content: And that is why I have an old school cell phone...

Author: dotcoma
Content: is this whole thing a B2B proposition (someone hosts data, someone else pays for the delivery of the part of this data they need - which is great, don't get me wrong) or could this also become a "consumer" B2C thing? (i.e. I sell digital crap, and charge users via Amazon).
